skill.name: snapdom
skill.description: snapDOM is a fast, accurate DOM-to-image capture tool that converts HTML elements into scalable SVG images. Use for capturing HTML elements, converting DOM to images (SVG, PNG, JPG, WebP), preserving styles, fonts, and pseudo-elements.
skill.summary: snapDOM is a fast, accurate DOM-to-image capture tool that converts HTML elements into scalable SVG ...
skill.author: 2025Emma

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files describing the snapDOM library. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access is present in the skill package itself. The library runs in browser environments using standard Web APIs.

content.value_statement: Capture HTML elements as images for documentation, sharing, or archival purposes. SnapDOM converts DOM elements to SVG, PNG, JPG, or WebP formats with style preservation.
actual_capabilities: Convert HTML elements to SVG, PNG, JPG, or WebP formats
Preserve CSS styles, fonts, and pseudo-elements in exports
Handle cross-origin resources using proxy fallback options
Export with custom dimensions, scaling, and quality settings
Exclude specific elements from capture using CSS selectors
Create responsive screenshots at different device scales
limitations: Runs only in browser environments with DOM access
Cannot capture elements outside the visible viewport without scrolling
Complex shadow DOM structures may need special handling

best_practices: Set embedFonts to true when custom fonts are essential for the visual
Use scale parameter instead of width/height for better performance
Test CORS proxy configuration early if capturing external resources
anti_patterns: Capturing entire page without specifying exclude selectors leads to unnecessary content
Using high scale values on large elements causes memory issues
Ignoring font loading timing results in missing typography

faq.question: What formats does snapdom support?
faq.answer: SnapDOM supports SVG, PNG, JPG, WebP exports, plus raw Canvas and Blob outputs for custom processing.

faq.question: Can snapdom capture complex CSS effects?
faq.answer: Yes, it preserves shadows, transforms, pseudo-elements, CSS counters, and line-clamp properties.

faq.question: How does snapdom handle CORS issues?
faq.answer: Enable the useProxy option with a CORS proxy URL to load cross-origin images and resources.

faq.question: Is user data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: SnapDOM runs locally in the browser. No data is sent to external servers unless a custom proxy is configured.

faq.question: Why are my captures incomplete?
faq.answer: Ensure elements are fully rendered and fonts loaded. Check that content is within viewport or use straighten: false for transformed elements.

faq.question: How does snapdom compare to html2canvas?
faq.answer: SnapDOM is 10-40x faster with no dependencies, but html2canvas may have broader compatibility with older browsers.
